headline: Air Fryer Chicken Thighs
description: These air fryer chicken thighs are incredibly juicy with crisp skin. Ready in 30 minutes, these tasty paprika-rubbed chicken thighs are always a hit!

video.description: These juicy chicken thighs done in under 30 minutes and the air fryer makes it so easy!
video.name: How to Make Air Fryer Chicken Thighs

name: Air Fryer Chicken Thighs

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Pat chicken thighs dry with a paper towel and brush skins with olive oil. Place chicken thighs, skin-side down, in a single layer on a plate.

Combine smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Sprinkle 1/2 of the seasoning mixture evenly over thighs. Turn thighs over and evenly sprinkle with remaining seasoning. Arrange thighs, skin-side up, in a single layer in the air fryer basket.

Cook in the preheated air fryer until thighs are brown and the juices run clear, about 18 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: It was my first try so I stuck to the recipe. It was fine and using the air fryer was great.
Crispy skin, close to pan fried, would recommend.

Really enjoyed this air fryer chicken recipe, as did my son and husband! I made it with bone-in thighs, substituted smoked paprika with 2/3 tsp paprika and 1/3 tsp cumin. Cooked for slightly less than 30 min, turned over at 15 minutes. Skin was crispy and delicious. Will most definitely add this into our meal rotation!!
They were delicious, no changes, will make them this way from now on.
Was good. I just got an air fryer so needed this recipe Thanx

So easy and adaptable. I combined smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, parsley and easy-blend flour. Instead of olive oil, I dipped the chicken in a mixture of milk with a splash of bovril chicken bouillon concentrate, then put in spice mixture. It was delicious.

Made this using bone-in thighs. Also brined them before starting the prep. Spice is very simple and very effective. Adjusted the cooking time to 14 minutes total, flipping after 8 min. Cooked to almost exactly 165 F. Stayed moist, with crisp skin. Will definitely do this again.

I used skinless, boneless thighs and added Litehouse Poultry Seasoning besides the other seasonings listed. The chicken was delicious, though a little dry without the skin. But so quick and convenient in the airfryer! I will make this again!
Oh my these were so good, the skin was crispy and the meat inside was so tender and cooked perfectly, I will definitely make these again.!

My chicken thighs lacked the skin, so I dredged it with the olive oil rather than just brush it. And it turned out moist and flavorful! I have a PamperedChef air fryer. There isn't a preheat feature, so I just ran it on the fryer setting for 5 minutes before adding the chicken. I could become addicted to the recipe.
really easy and tasted great

I seasoned the chicken thighs. Added chicken stock and cooked fat side down at 375 for 15 minutes. Flipped the chicken and cooked another fifteen minutes. added precooked rice and and a little more chicken stock and cooked 10 more minutes. The chicken stock blended with the fat from chicken and it came out crispy, moist and tender.

I bagged the spices in a Ziploc and skipped the oil altogether. I used skinless boneless chicken tenders. Shook them up and put them in the air fryer for 18 minutes at 400. Amazing! Ranch dip on the side. Family cleaned the plates, including our 17 yr old son!

I have fallen off of a log before, but this was waaay easier! This is so easy and , I started cooking them for my dog. Thighs are so forgiving, I give the larger ones 20 full minutes and check the temp when they are done. It's always 170-ish which is perfect for me. Given the bones, I prefer 170F over 165F so it is all definitely not red next to the bone. After a few minutes rest, they are simply delicious.

Seasoning was very good for 5 skin off bone-in chicken thighs and thighs did come out juicy and skin was crispy. Air fryer did start smoking near end of cooking time. Will make again adjusting temperature to 375.
easy and delicious
Delicious! I forgot the olive oil and once I realized it, I used canola cooking spray and sprayed the skin. Still came out crispy and yummy! Will make again.

The chicken thighs were delicious but my air fryer was really smoking! Had to open up the windows & turn on the fan. I used bone in thighs...next time I'll try boneless, skinless thighs or omit the olive oil.
Really good quick way to cook chicken to cut up later to add to salad or whatever! You can always use with bone in, just cook a bit longer! Will keep this handy for a fast fix!
I love this recipe! Bone-in thighs 15 min on each side. So moist and delicious!!
Made 2 times great both time crispy skin moist meat
I made this with boneless, skinless chicken breasts. Turned out very juicy.
Was helpful for the time needed, although mine took about 30 minutes to cook. I used 2 min timer after the 18 min to check it. I'm new to air frying. Spices were okay.
Turned out great!
Used baking powder,with a Ghost Pepper Dry Rub from a local pub, turned out crispy, spicy..
I enjoyed it and didn’t change a thing. It was nice and crispy and the flavour was good
Followed the recipe to a T, they turned out great, crispy flavorful skin, juicy meat. Keeper!
The recipe is very good but I added sambal oelek and ketchup manis and my kids loved it.

Used bone-in thighs because - WHY wouldn’t you? Only two fit in the Air fryer at a time so the first batch hung out in 225* oven whilst the 2nd batch went in. 20 minutes apiece. Spice mix could’ve used a coupla shakes of Ancho chile powder, which they got. No mess or overpowering smell of a fryolator was the overwhelming bonus of this method

The thighs were so delicious but had to air-fry them a little longer. It could have been because they had the bones in and were not skinless. My grocery store didn't have the skinless, boneless ones but regardless, they were so tasty can't wait to cook them again.

Used bone-in thighs with skin and cooked for 20 min in my Ninja air fryer. Had 6 large pieces and cooked 3 at a time so as not to crowd. Delicious and perfectly cooked! The crispy skin was the best part. Hubby loved it. Would use less salt next time.

Loved this recipe! So did my hubby:)
I'm not sure where skin-on boneless thighs are sold, so I just went with the skin-on with bone chicken thighs. The bone-in adds more moisture to the meat! The thighs cooked for about 23 min, to ensure 165 degrees internal temp. I used McCormick Organic Smoked Paprika; was expecting a smokier flavor. But overall, a very tasty dish! Forgot to take a pic :/
Not used to using thighs. Greasier meat. Otherwise,good.
Outstanding!
This was the first recipe I made in my new air fryer. It was great. The chicken was juicy, the skin crisp. Then I made it again, the next night. Perfect.
Great recipe!

I omitted the black pepper and added a generous seasoning of Lemon pepper. I love lemon garlic chicken. This came out juicy, delicious and I added 3 minutes per side because my chicken thighs were huge. Came out perfect!
Yummy!

Tasty, Quick, what's not to love about this recipe?! the whole family loved it! made it as written and they came out perfect. Only problem I had was I didn't make enough for 2nds. Thanks for sharing this with us. I have already been asked to make it again and its only been 4 days since I made it!!!
Great recipe! Chicken came out browned and flavorful.

This is the first time I've cooked chicken thighs in ages and these were so delicious. I used boneless, skinless thighs and because they were so large I had to use my rack to double up in the air fryer. They were done in 23 minutes.
Came out great!! Will be using this recipe again. Thanks for sharing.

This recipe for chicken thighs was great! I followed the recipe as listed. Didn’t change a thing. Thighs were juicy. The skin was crispy! My son loved them. No leftovers. Now I need a good air fryer recipe for chicken breast.
Super easy and delicious.

Great recipe for my new air fryer. Easy recipe with lots of flavor. I also had to cook longer than suggested, esp since I wanted deep golden color so I cooked for 25 minutes. I tried with skin and without and cook time still longer than the recipe. I tried this recipe for wings and then added buffalo sauce - amazing. My family loved the thighs so this is a keeper.

I made these exactly as posted. The only difference was after I dried the chicken and applied the spices, I put them in the fridge to marinate for about 3 hours prior to cooking. The taste was through out the entire chicken. Excellent recipe Bibi!
One of the first things I cooked with my new air fryer. Definitely takes longer than recipe calls for - 30 minutes. Thighs turned out great and tasted great. Easy to cook.

Tried making it, it smoked so much after 3 minutes it set the smoke alarms in the basement and 2nd floor off. Kitchen was full of smoke, had to abort, put it in a pan and cooked it in the oven. Doesn't work in my Philips Air Fryer. Maybe outside, but then I would just use the Weber.

Needed to increase cooking time! I don't know where they came up with 20 minutes. I ended up going for 30, then I still put them in oven. There was just a bit too much pink for me. That bothers me with chicken. I will not use this receipe again. Very disappointed.
Great recipe!!!

Have prepared this several times. Husband loves it! Since just the 2 of us at home now, 4 thighs in the air fryer easy peasy! Agree with cooking a bit longer. Seasoning as stated good for us but may do little experimenting. ??
Easy and delicious! Will definitely make again! Used bone-in (couldn't find boneless) and it was great!

This looks great...but none of the recipes say whether to use the drip tray or not. Need to know when to use it and when not to. 

Thanks
I love how crispy the skin came out. The chicken was juicy and tender. Also was full of flavor. I had a bone in chicken thigh. I cooked for 25 minutes.

Happily simple enough for me 
 No changes
Easy and delicious!

This is a simple, quick dinner that works! I used 4 skin on, bone in thighs, used smoked paprika and added a small amount of cracked rosemary to the rub. 20 minutes did it. Perfect. Crispy skin, juicy meat. This one's a keeper!

We love this recipe and use it with bone IN chicken thighs. They turn out amazing. And every store I go to, I look for boneless skin on chicken thighs and I’ve never seen them (in over a year) but I’ll keep searching haha
real easy to make. added more heat (spices). cooked up so nice and moist. Will certainly try again and tweak some more.
Awesome air fryer recipe! Very easy and turned out prefect. Made recipe as written but used bone in thighs and cooked for 20 minutes.
About 10 minutes in and checked my chicken thighs and skin was burnt to a crisp. But rest of chicken was juicy and tender. May need to just adjust the temp next time.
pretty good and very simple to do.
I Made no changes...was first recipe using air fryer. They came out great....great grandson loved them!
Excellent!!! Fixed as is with the ingredients but cooked my 4 at 400 for 25 minutes. They were perfect!!! Juicy, flavorful & crisped just right!!! Thank you
Great, quick recipe. Didn't change a thing. Came out perfect. Thank you

This recipe is absolutely delicious and so easy to make! I'm new to the air fryer and made this recipe exactly as written. The flavors were so good and the chicken was so moist with a nice crisp on the outside. Even my chicken thigh hater enjoyed this recipe. I have a Pampered Chef Air Fryer and the cook time was a little longer, but not by much. This will be a go to recipe for us. Thanks for the recipe!
Really good and moist!

This recipe is the bomb dot com! I didn't have olive oil so I used Italian dressing. I cooked them exactly 18 minutes and they were perfect. Nice and juicy and full of flavor. This was the first recipe I used in my new air fryer and wow I'm a convert already. Thank you, person who shared it!
Loved it! Easy and tasty!
I use it for the base of many thigh recipes that I put a sause on after cooking easy and quick

GREAT recipe. I like a bit more flavor, maybe more salt. I haven't figured it out yet, but this is a good starter recipe for sure. I cooked one thigh at a time at 30 minutes as I have a smaller fryer (I think). All in all, good stuff! Thank you for the recipe!
so much better Air Fried, love the taste
Perfect recipe for air fryer as a starting base. I have made it several times using different seasoning combinations. A perfect low calorie dinner.
This is the best chicken I have tasted in years, absolutely delicious. I recommend that you cook for 30 minutes rather than the 18 suggested. It will still come out tender and juicy.
Very easy and tasty!!

It came out great. I made the boneless and still came out great. My first meal on the Air Fryer. Can't wait to make other meals ... best kitchen appliance/accessory to have, it matches my instant Pot ...

YUM! Delicious Flavor, Moist, Easy, Quick!!!!
The easiest and fastest air fryer chicken recipe I've made so far. I'll definitely be making it again and telling all my friends about it. THANKS!
Delicious and easy recipe. I followed recipe & instructions and it was excellent.i love it!!!
This is now my go to recipe for chicken thighs. Followed the recipe exactly but cooked closer to 30 minutes. Delicious!

Loved it. I did cook it a bit longer than the recipe called for, but my chicken thighs were pretty big. Better safe than sorry. They were done perfectly, skin was crisped but not burnt, and they were nice and moist. This is my 'go-to' recipe now.
i used a premade spice mix and used skinless thighs. its pretty good I'll definitely have to make it for our kids
This recipe was delicious

This is the first thing I’ve made using the air fry function on my new Ninja Foodi 6.5 quart Pressure Cooker Tender Crisper. My husband absolutely loved it! It has great flavor and is completely done on both sides good and crispy and I didn’t have to turn it over at all. I put four chicken thighs in skin side up and cooked them on air fry for 30 minutes. I love it! Thank you so much for a quick, easy and very tasty recipe!

This is one of the best air fryer chicken recipes that I've ever tried. I didn't change, too much, just used my preferred spices. It came out so juicy and flavorful. And, took the exact cook time that it called for.
S. H. From Iowa
So delicious. Chicken was juicy on the inside and crunchy on the outside. Excellent flavor too.
Comes out better than in the oven.It is not dried out. Very happy everyone loved it.
Very flavorful and crispy. I followed the recipe as noted and we loved it. This is definitely a keeper!!

My family loves this! I just sprinkle the spices on top of the chicken instead of mixing them in a bowl. I cooked 12 min, flipped and cooked additional 12. Made with skinless thighs and also tenderloins.
Sprinkled with Italian seasoning and some garlic salt after brushing the oil on. Otherwise, perfect recipe.

Definitely takes longer than the time suggested from this recipe. Cooking time is ATLEAST 30 minutes! Besides having to adjust the cooking time my teenage son loved the finished result, crispy skin withOUT having to fry it.

I am not a cook at all. I got an air fryer to get frozen french fries and egg rolls crisp. Tonight I made chicken for the first time in the air fryer following this recipe exactly and my husband said it is the best chicken he's ever tasted.
Oh my word! These are fabulous. I followed the recipe except I used 1.5 times the seasonings called for. Thank you, Bibi!!
Delicious and easy recipe. I followed recipe & instructions with the following modifications:
Delicious! I had 5 thighs, used cayenne chili pepper oil, and only dash of salt. Will be trying on boneless breasts next time, or maybe a pork chop!

This was the first recipe I made after I got an air fryer lid for my InstantPot. The chicken was delicious and the skin was crisp. I thought the seasoning was perfect. I cooked the thighs skin-side up for 20 minutes, but they weren't quite done, so I turned them upside down and cooked them for another 6 minutes. That was enough to have the chicken thoroughly cooked. I got a thumbs-up from the guys in my family!
Good recipe. Next time I won't use as much salt. I cooked thighs for 25 minutes to make sure they were done. Will definitely make again.
Very nice and easy. Used bone-in thighs and a meat thermometer. Temp and length were perfect to bring chicken to 165 degrees.
The flavor was great, but the chicken was dry. I am playing with time and temp to get a juicy piece of chicken. My last batch was done at 380 degrees for 14 minutes, still dry internal temp of 185.
Good taste, easy, quick
